about:
Using a pulse-oximeter is a quick and painless way to measure the oxygen levels in your blood. This gives a good indication of how well your heart and lungs are working. A normal level is typically between 95-100% but can be lower if you have chronic lung disease.Â 


Use this feature to share the results with your care team. Make sure you are not wearing any dark nail polish as it can cause inaccurate readings.

footnote.text: If you think you may be experiencing a medical emergency, call your doctor or the emergency services immediately.

notificationData.title: Oxygen Saturation
notificationData.body: Time to submit data for Oxygen Saturation
